alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 5:38PM EDT until July 05 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Laurel, Pulaski and Rockcastle. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloss, Pongo, Hansford, Billows, Luner, Level Green, Sand Springs, Valley Oak, Wabp, Bromo, Willailla, Quail, Woodstock, Bandy, Bunch, Bernstadt, Ottowa and Bee Lick.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
